choices.B: It automates threat responses of an infected host.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Cisco Secure Endpoint (formerly AMP for Endpoints) makes it easy to establish protection, detection, response, and user access coverage to defend against every threat to your endpoints.

questions.question_text: What is a function of Cisco AMP for Endpoints?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
an infection spreading accross network

C. an infection spreading across the network

Endpoint is isolated, which means it is preventing it from spreading to other devices.

Selected Answer: C
C is Correct:

Endpoint Isolation is a feature that lets you block incoming and outgoing network activity on a Windows computer to prevent threats such as data exfiltration and malware propagation.

https://cloudmanaged.ca/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/AMP-for-Endpoints-User-Guide.pdf

This helps the infection not spreading to other endpoints on the network.

Selected Answer: C
The question asks about 'endpoint isolation' specifically. I'd say that has more to do C i.e. "spreading across the network" as opposed to B "spreading across the user device".

Selected Answer: C
It is an easy one. C.
If an endpoint is infected, you isolate it from the rest of the network to avoid propagation, the endpoint itself is already infected so B is not correct.

You also can check this out:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security/secure-endpoint/218064-troubleshoot-secure-endpoint-stuck-in-is.html#:~:text=Endpoint%20isolation%20is%20a%20feature,data%20exfiltration%20and%20malware%20propagation.

Selected Answer: C
C. an infection spreading across the network

When an endpoint is identified as compromised or infected with malware, endpoint isolation isolates the infected endpoint from the network to prevent the infection from spreading to other devices or systems. By isolating the infected endpoint, it helps contain the threat and prevents lateral movement of the malware within the network. This helps in minimizing the impact of the infection and allows security teams to investigate and remediate the compromised endpoint effectively.
C isolation stops all network except communications to amp cloud for malware analysis

Selected Answer: C
The answer should be C.

Selected Answer: C
When it says isolation, the question is isolation from what? If the user endpoint is infected by malware, it is done. The following action isolates the endpoint to prevent malware from spreading to others via the network.

Isolation isolates an endpoint from the network, to avoid a spread to other endpoints.
Answer is C

Selected Answer: C
C is correct.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct:
Endpoint isolation is a feature that lets you block incoming and outgoing network activity on a Windows computer to prevent threats such as data exfiltration and malware propagation. It is available on 64-bit versions of Windows that support version 7.0.5 and later of the connector.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
The answer should have been B.

comments.content: it prevents it from spreading to the rest of the network when the host is infected

Think about what you're saying, the host is already infected, what do you deem more valuable, trying to protect a single host that is infected with Malware or the entire network that this host is on (i.e. subnet/VLAN/department)? It's clearly C.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Why C? should be option B, cisco AMP is Endpoint isolation is a feature that is specifically focused on preventing the spread of malware on an infected endpoint.

choices.B: a malware spreading across the user device
choices.D: a malware spreading across the LDAP or Active Directory domain from a user account
choices.C: an infection spreading across the network
choices.A: an infection spreading across the LDAP or Active Directory domain from a user account

questions.question_text: What does endpoint isolation in Cisco AMP for Endpoints security protect from?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/wsa/wsa11-0/user_guide/b_WSA_UserGuide/b_WSA_UserGuide_chapter_0110.html#:~:text=Enabling%20Participation%20in,commit%20your%20changes.

Selected Answer: D
The 'engineer recently completed the system setting'. No additional information added and by default the WSA uses Standard-- which summarized server-name information and MD5-hashed path information to SensorBase Network servers.

Selected Answer: A
I don't see any issues with "A", however my grammar is not that good. My logic says, that the wording "with unobfuscated" means the same as "without obfuscated".

Selected Answer: A
STANDARD SensorBase Network Participation is enabled by default during system setup.

Selected Answer: D
Would have to agree with MPoels on this one and select D.

Yes, STANDARD SensorBase Network Participation is enabled by default during system setup..

But as MPoels also pointed out, the wording of Option A makes it incorrect. Maybe it's a typo here and it's worded differently on the actual exam.....

For that reason, I'm sticking with D and implying that the engineer configured the "Limited" Participation Level as opposed to the "Standard".

Selected Answer: D
Correct answer is D.

Yes, SensorBase is turned on by default but the engineer choose the participation level "Limited" NOT "Standard". The key flaw in proposed answer A is the keyword “without.”
Cisco guide description of participation level "Standard": Enhanced participation sends the entire URL with (!!!) unobfuscated path segments to the SensorBase Network servers.
Cisco guide description of participation level "Limit": Basic participation summarizes server name information and sends MD5-hashed path segments to the SensorBase Network servers.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/wsa/wsa_14-1/User-Guide/b_WSA_UserGuide_14_01/b_WSA_UserGuide_11_7_chapter_00.html

Selected Answer: A
A is correct - SensorBase is turned on and set to “standard” by default:

Limited. Basic participation summarizes server name information and sends MD5-hashed path segments to the SensorBase Network servers.
Standard. Enhanced participation sends the entire URL with unobfuscated path segments to the SensorBase Network servers. This option assists in providing a more robust database, and continually improves the integrity of Web Reputation Scores.

Selected Answer: A
Standard SensorBase Network Participation is enabled by default during system setup.

Standard. Enhanced participation sends the entire URL with unobfuscated path segments to the SensorBase Network servers. This option assists in providing a more robust database, and continually improves the integrity of Web Reputation Scores.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/wsa/wsa_14-1/User-Guide/b_WSA_UserGuide_14_01/b_WSA_UserGuide_11_7_chapter_00.html?bookSearch=true

questions.question_text: An engineer recently completed the system setup on a Cisco WSA. Which URL information does the system send to SensorBase Network servers?

choices.C: none because SensorBase Network Participation is disabled by default
choices.A: complete URL, without obfuscating the path segments
choices.D: summarized server-name information and MD5-hashed path information
choices.B: URL information collected from clients that connect to the Cisco WSA using Cisco AnyConnect

discussion.content:
POST /dna/intent/api/v1/onboarding/pnp-device/import

Onboarding (PnP) API
The Device Onboarding API supports the PnP process, giving the developer the option to create a workflow that detects when a device joins the network and communicates with Cisco DNA Center, and then sending the onboarding configuration to the device.

https://developer.cisco.com/docs/dna-center/#!device-onboarding/onboarding-pnp-api

questions.question_text: Which Cisco DNA Center RESTful PNP API adds and claims a device into a workflow?
